comms_internal: intransitive construction with the complex NP (DC: yes, it is a genuine NP) ‘X ati Y’ in subject function, lit. ‘Y’s X aches’ (ati is a genitival linker). The verb is the same as 26 'eat'
transitive construction, but the illness is encoded as the subject (lit. ‘illness catches person’), same verb as 43
X nokoor di Y ~ X di Y nokoor. intransitive constructions (di is a locative/comitative preposition, also used for NP coordination)
Also an alternative verb fium (same construction), which was dispreferred because it was used for another entry (112)
Fooñi has no simple equivalent of ‘influence ; various periphrases can be used, depending on the precise meaning.
X di Y yaañoor ~ X yaañoor di Y. См. обсуждение промежуточных свойств этой конструкции (комитатив / сочинение) в анкете. Интересно, что даже при дистантном положении сочинение все равно по плюралису

The quotative verb oon is used exclusively to introduce reported speech. The adressee (Y) is encoded like the patient in the basic transitive construction. Z represents the quotation. There is also a ditransitive verb reg used to express things like ‘He told me the truth’.
Same verb as 79
Та же ситуация, что с глаголом 11
X di Y paaloor ~ X paaloor di Y. intransitive construction (di is a locative/comitative preposition, also used for NP coordination)

Fooñi has no obvious equivalent of ‘depend on’; various periphrases are available depending on the precise meaning, for example ‘The whole family depends on him’ can be expressed as ‘It’s him who bears the whole family.’
Same as 33
Same as 32
Same verb as 106 ('hit')
Interestingly, this verb has been borrowed from Mandinka, but the construction is different (extended intransitive in Mandinka, transitive in Fooñi)
Same verb as 113, 119, 121, 129
Same verb as 88

Трансимперсональная конструкция. In Fooñi, ‘X is called Y’ can only be rendered, either as lit. ‘they say to X “Y”’ (with a 3rd person plural subject interpreted as non-specific), or as ‘X’s name is Y’. Есть пример.

Fooñi has no general equivalent of ‘punish’ ; the translation of English sentences including ‘punish’ implies specifying a particular type of punishment (‘They hit him’, They killed him’, ‘They put him in jail’, ‘They fined him’, etc.).
С тем же самым глаголом возможная и зеркальная конструкция (Y meeŋ X). Какая частотнее, DC не знает. Выбрал эту как первую и внешне более похожую на стимул.

Значение выражается при помощи отрицания yaj, но это значит "have enough", и "be enough". Какая там синтаксическая структура, я так и не видел, но решил не засчитывать, раз это все равно уже имеющийся глагол только с отрицанием, к тому же не все понятно
Interestingly, this verb (whose ultimate source is Arabic) has been borrowed from Mandinka, but the construction is different (extended intransitive in Mandinka, transitive in Fooñi)
Impersonal double object construction (sth. like 'il m'est reste de l'argent). Также возможна, но более редка, конструкция Y riino X (cf. l'argent m'est reste).
X di Y búutóor ~ X búutóor di Y. intransitive constructions (di is a locative/comitative preposition, also used for NP coordination)
Наверное, не засчитываем. Можно сказать только либо X is behind Y (связка, семантики движения нет, как я понимаю; примера нет), либо Y обогнал X.
Только перифрастическая каузативная конструкция, которая в этом языке биклаузальная
Same verb as 93
Same verb as 22
libo ‘cut oneself’ derives from the transitive verb lib ‘cut’
This verb has no obvious equivalent in Fooñi, and the meaning it expresses is normally expressed as ‘Y wins X’ (see 13).
intransitive construction (mati can be analyzed as a preposition ‘because of’)
Только перифрастическая каузативная конструкция, которая в этом языке биклаузальная
Same verb as 48

Same verb as 78
X di Y símpóor ~ X símpóor di Y. Intransitive construction (di is a locative/comitative preposition, also used for NP coordination)
X di Y jamoor ~ X jamoor di Y. Intransitive construction (di is a locative/comitative preposition)
X di Y lob, X lob di Y. Intransitive construction (di is a locative/comitative preposition, also used for NP coordination)
There is no verb with this meaning in Fooñi, and ‘cost’ is usually expressed by means of a verbless construction, for example ‘This car, one million’.
X ya Y épímbén. double-object construction (épímbén ‘gun’)
lit. ‘X’s Y gets lost’ (¬ati is a genitival linker)
intransitive construction (di is a locative/comitative preposition). → yúó derives from yú (102)
Same verb as 34 (play percussions, strings)
Kissing with the mouth is not traditional in West African cultures, and my Fooñi consultants did not put forward any possible equivalent of this verb.
Same verb as 46, 119, 121, 129
Alternative verb fium (same construction), which was dispreferred because it was used for another entry (112)
Same verb as 122 and 128
transitive construction, but the experiencer is encoded as the object, and the stimulus as the subject. → borrowed from Mandinka
Same verb as 46, 113, 121, 129
Fooñi has no simple equivalent of this verb ; the notion it expresses can only be rendered periphrastically.
Same verb as 46, 113, 119, 129
Same verb as 117 and 128
Fooñi has a transitive verb lús ‘offend, vex’, but ‘take offence’ at can only be expressed periphrastically.
Fooñi has no obvious equivalent of this verb ; the notion it expresses can only be rendered periphrastically.
Interestingly, this verb has been borrowed from Mandinka, but the construction is different (extended intransitive in Mandinka, transitive in Fooñi)

Возможна также переходная конструкция с глаголом puñ, в котооой стимул занимает позицию подлежащего. puño образован от него при помощи детранзитивирующего / медиального показателя. Выбрал эту конструкции как более точно соответствующую стимулу и непереходную
